verses.verse: I will leave in your midst (Is. 14:32; Zech. 13:8, 9) A meek and humble people, And they shall trust in the name of the LORD.

(Is. 10:20-22; (Mic. 4:7)) The remnant of Israel (Is. 60:21) shall do no unrighteousness (Zech. 8:3, 16; Rev. 14:5) And speak no lies, Nor shall a deceitful tongue be found in their mouth; For (Ezek. 34:13-15, 28) they shall feed their flocks and lie down, And no one shall make them afraid.”
Joy in God’s Faithfulness (Is. 12:6) Sing, O daughter of Zion! Shout, O Israel! Be glad and rejoice with all your heart, O daughter of Jerusalem!
The LORD has taken away your judgments, He has cast out your enemy. ((John 1:49)) The King of Israel, the LORD, (Ezek. 48:35; (Rev. 7:15)) is in your midst; You shall see disaster no more.
In that day (Is. 35:3, 4) it shall be said to Jerusalem: “Do not fear; Zion, (Job 4:3; Heb. 12:12) let not your hands be weak.

The LORD your God (Zeph. 3:5, 15) in your midst, The Mighty One, will save; (Deut. 30:9; Is. 62:5; 65:19; Jer. 32:41) He will rejoice over you with gladness, He will quiet you with His love, He will rejoice over you with singing.”
“I will gather those who (Lam. 2:6) sorrow over the appointed assembly, Who are among you, To whom its reproach is a burden.

Behold, at that time I will deal with all who afflict you; I will save the ((Ezek. 34:16; Mic. 4:6, 7)) lame, And gather those who were driven out; I will appoint them for praise and fame In every land where they were put to shame.

At that time (Is. 11:12; Ezek. 28:25; Amos 9:14) I will bring you back, Even at the time I gather you; For I will give you fame and praise Among all the peoples of the earth, When I return your captives before your eyes,” Says the LORD.

The Command to Build God’s House In (Ezra 4:24; Hag. 2:10; Zech. 1:1, 7) the second year of King Darius, in the sixth month, on the first day of the month, the word of the LORD came by (Ezra 5:1; 6:14) Haggai the prophet to (1 Chr. 3:19; Ezra 2:2; Neh. 7:7; Zech. 4:6; Matt. 1:12, 13) Zerubbabel the son of Shealtiel, governor of Judah, and to (Ezra 5:2, 3; Zech. 6:11) Joshua the son of (1 Chr. 6:15) Jehozadak, the high priest, saying,
“Thus speaks the LORD of hosts, saying: ‘This people says, “The time has not come, the time that the LORD’s house should be built.” ’ ”
Then the word of the LORD (Ezra 5:1) came by Haggai the prophet, saying,
“Is it (2 Sam. 7:2) time for you yourselves to dwell in your paneled houses, and this temple to lie in ruins?”
Now therefore, thus says the LORD of hosts: (Lam. 3:40) “Consider your ways!

“You have (Deut. 28:38-40; Hos. 8:7; Hag. 1:9, 10; 2:16, 17) sown much, and bring in little; You eat, but do not have enough; You drink, but you are not filled with drink; You clothe yourselves, but no one is warm; And (Zech. 8:10) he who earns wages, Earns wages to put into a bag with holes.”
